sub_concepts.name: Nucleotide
sub_concepts.definition: The basic unit of DNA, consisting of a sugar molecule, a phosphate group, and a nitrogenous base.

sub_concepts.name: Double Helix
sub_concepts.definition: The structural shape of DNA, formed by two strands of nucleotides coiled together and held together by hydrogen bonds between the bases.

sub_concepts.name: Deoxyribose
sub_concepts.definition: The sugar molecule that makes up the backbone of a DNA molecule.

sub_concepts.name: Nitrogenous Bases
sub_concepts.definition: Sections of DNA that contain the instructions for the development and function of an organism.

sub_concepts.name: Chromosomes
sub_concepts.definition: Thread-like structures made up of DNA and protein that contain genetic information.

sub_concepts.name: Genome
sub_concepts.definition: The complete set of genetic information contained in the DNA of an organism.

sub_concepts.name: Replication
sub_concepts.definition: The process by which DNA makes a copy of itself before cell division.

sub_concepts.name: Transcription
sub_concepts.definition: The process by which the information in a DNA molecule is used to produce an RNA molecule.

sub_concepts.name: Translation
sub_concepts.definition: The process by which the genetic code in an RNA molecule is used to produce a protein.
